info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 3 at 3:01AM MDT until July 3 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
FFWABQ
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Valencia County in central New Mexico...
* Until 600 AM MDT.
* At 301 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain moving slowly northwest across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen around Meadow Lake and on the mesas east of Peralta, Valencia, and Tome-Adelino. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Los Lunas, Valencia, El Cerro Mission, Rio Communities North, Meadow Lake, Tome, Peralta and Adelino.
Flash flooding may occur along portions of State Road 263, Sandhill Road, Manzano Expressway, and La Entrada Road.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
